newsitem.title: USA: U.S. crudes slip lower on fundamental oversupply.
newsitem.headline: U.S. crudes slip lower on fundamental oversupply.

text.p: U.S. cash crude outright prices and the differentials paid for domestic grade barrels declined Tuesday on increased flows of foreign imports.
Markets continued to accumulate supplies, outweighing present demand in the U.S. Gulf Coast, despite active refiner interest, traders said.
Outright May West Texas Intermediate/Cushing slipped around 15 cents to talk late at $20.15-25 a barrel, after moving earlier in the session on gasoline market rallying.
Late release of the American Petroleum Institute (API) inventory data had little immediate impact on crude prices.
